title: 114_hr5879
content: MODIFICATIONS OF CREDIT FOR PRODUCTION FROM ADVANCED NUCLEAR POWER FACILITIES. The amendment to Section 45J(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes the allocation of unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation by the Secretary. This allocation is to be done rapidly after December 31, 2020, first to facilities placed in service before that date and then to facilities placed in service after that date. The amendment to Section 45J(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 involves the allocation of unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation by the Secretary. This allocation prioritizes facilities placed in service before December 31, 2020, and then those placed after that date. The unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation is defined as the excess of 6,000 megawatts over the aggregate amount allocated before January 1, 2021, minus any allocation to facilities not in service by that date. The amendment to Section 45J of the Internal Revenue Code involves the transfer of credits by certain public entities for renewable energy projects. The amendment to Section 45J of the Internal Revenue Code allows qualified public entities to transfer renewable energy project credits to eligible project partners. The amendment allows qualified public entities to transfer renewable energy project credits to eligible project partners, defined as government entities, mutual or cooperative electric companies, not-for-profit electric utilities with Rural Electrification Act loans, and persons involved in designing or constructing advanced nuclear power facilities. The term 'eligible project partner' includes individuals involved in designing, constructing, providing nuclear steam supply systems, supplying nuclear fuel, or having ownership interest in an advanced nuclear power facility eligible for the credit under subsection (a). Special rules apply to partnerships for determining the credit. The term 'eligible project partner' includes individuals involved in designing, constructing, providing nuclear steam supply systems, supplying nuclear fuel, or having ownership interest in an advanced nuclear power facility eligible for the credit under subsection (a). Special rules apply to partnerships for determining the credit, where a qualified public entity is treated as the taxpayer with respect to their distributive share of the credit, and any partner of the partnership is considered an eligible project partner. The credit must be taken into account in the first taxable year of the eligible project partner ending with, or after, the qualified year. The curr_chunk discusses the treatment of credits and transfers for eligible project partners, specifying that credits must be taken into account in the first taxable year of the partner. It also addresses the treatment of benefits derived from transfers under private use rules. Additionally, a special rule is outlined for mutual or cooperative electric companies regarding income derived from transfers. The curr_chunk amends Section 501(c)(12) of the Code for mutual or cooperative electric companies, treating income from transfers under section 45J(e)(1) as collected for meeting losses. Effective dates are specified for the amendments.
